description: Optimized skill index - merged 9 skills into 4 core skills

skills.name: frontend-design
skills.description: Create distinctive, production-grade frontend interfaces with high design quality
skills.trigger: when user asks to build web components, pages, artifacts, posters, or applications

skills.name: docx
skills.description: Comprehensive document creation, editing, and analysis with support for tracked changes and comments
skills.trigger: when working with .docx files for creating, editing, or analyzing documents

skills.name: pdf
skills.description: Comprehensive PDF manipulation toolkit for extracting text, creating new PDFs, and handling forms
skills.trigger: when working with PDF forms, extraction, or programmatic processing

skills.name: pptx
skills.description: Presentation creation, editing, and analysis with layout support
skills.trigger: when working with presentations (.pptx files)

skills.name: xlsx
skills.description: Comprehensive spreadsheet creation, editing, and analysis with formula support
skills.trigger: when working with spreadsheets for reading, analyzing, or creating data

skills.name: canvas-design
skills.description: Create beautiful visual art in .png and .pdf documents using design philosophy
skills.trigger: when user asks to create a poster, piece of art, design, or other static visual piece

skills.name: mcp-builder
skills.description: Guide for creating high-quality MCP servers that enable LLMs to interact with external services
skills.trigger: when building MCP servers to integrate external APIs or services

skills.name: webapp-testing
skills.description: Toolkit for interacting with and testing local web applications using Playwright
skills.trigger: when testing frontend functionality, debugging UI behavior, or capturing browser screenshots

skills.name: orchestration
skills.description: Multi-agent orchestration with cc-mirror tasks and domain-specific workflows
skills.trigger: when coordinating multiple agents or workflows for complex tasks

skills.name: algorithmic-art
skills.description: Creating algorithmic art using p5.js with seeded randomness and interactive parameter exploration
skills.trigger: when user requests creating art using code, generative art, or algorithmic art

skills.name: slack-gif-creator
skills.description: Knowledge and utilities for creating animated GIFs optimized for Slack
skills.trigger: when user requests animated GIFs for Slack

skills.name: theme-factory
skills.description: Toolkit for styling artifacts with a theme - 10 pre-set themes with colors/fonts
skills.trigger: when applying consistent theming to documents, slides, or web pages

skills.name: skill-creator
skills.description: Guide for creating effective skills that extend Claude's capabilities
skills.trigger: when user wants to create a new skill or update an existing skill

skills.name: doc-coauthoring
skills.description: Guide users through structured workflow for co-authoring documentation
skills.trigger: when user wants to write documentation, proposals, technical specs, or decision docs

skills.name: brand-guidelines
skills.description: Applies Anthropic's official brand colors and typography to artifacts
skills.trigger: when brand colors or style guidelines apply to the artifact

skills.name: internal-comms
skills.description: Resources for writing internal communications in company-preferred formats
skills.trigger: when asked to write internal communications like status reports or newsletters

skills.name: web-artifacts-builder
skills.description: Tools for creating elaborate, multi-component HTML artifacts using modern frontend web technologies
skills.trigger: for complex artifacts requiring state management, routing, or shadcn/ui components

skills.name: quality-guard
skills.description: Code quality guardian - merged: code review + security check + dead code cleanup. Supports --security, --clean modes.
skills.trigger: when reviewing code, checking security, or cleaning up dead code

skills.name: test-master
skills.description: Test master - merged: TDD workflow + E2E testing. Supports --tdd, --e2e, --coverage modes.
skills.trigger: when writing tests, doing TDD, running E2E tests, or checking coverage

skills.name: design-brain
skills.description: Design brain - merged: planner + architect. Supports --quick (default) and --deep modes.
skills.trigger: when planning implementation or making architecture decisions

skills.name: quick-fix
skills.description: Quick fixer - fast build/lint/type error resolution using haiku model for speed and cost efficiency.
skills.trigger: when build fails, type errors occur, or lint errors need fixing
